page.title: 02Halsalls Farm.
page.content: There is quite a lot of farming in this area. Halsalls Farm is near Lea Endowed School.It is owned by the Cross family.It has had 3 generations and they are Mr Cross (senior) Mr Cross (junior) and daughter Katherine.They have one part-time worker.The farm machinery is three tractors,one mower,one baler, one tank cart and one mole trainer.They have fifty cows and forty-six are for milking.They also have fifty sheep and seventy breeding sows and a bull called Billy.The farm is one hundred acres with ten fields.They use their fields for making hay with no silage.The grass is then grazed.The cows after calving give around six gallons of milk a day.The milk is sold to the Milk Marketing Board.The farmhouse was built in 1850.
